PoK Podcast Link: What is the definition of nature? What happens when it changes?
Contributor: Nature is the most fundamental essence of something. If it changes, it is not the nature.

We see that the only unchanging aspect of this Existence is the witnessing of Experience, or the Experiencer itself. When we look closer to see what the Nature of the Experiencer is, we see nothing. Only Emptiness. We can reach the conclusion that Emptiness is the Nature of the Existence.

We take each person as an "Experiencer" because we falsely believe that the Experiencer is this body and mind. The body and mind appear to the Experiencer.

Verified: Memory is storage space in human brain
column5: Experiences are memory

These vibrations superimpose and self-perpetuate. Eventually, vibrational patterns arise that can take on incoming vibrations and can "replay" the incoming patterns. This is called Memory. Memory can then build more complex structures that filter incoming data for the benefit of the structure, these are called the senses. Remember that this explanation is firmly in the realm of "illusion" or the Experience and can not be said to be True based on our criteria for truth. It is a model to explain the Experience.

Experiences arise there which will change. The Experiences will be witnessed by You, the Experiencer. We take the waking state to be "real" and the other states to be false simply due to the appearance of stability and our familiarity with our stable, 5 senses. Change is slower in the waking state compared to the other states. Other states may also have different senses compared to the waking state senses.

Intellect and critical thinking allows us to investigate until the light of Awareness is known directly but again, will not arise until all lower layers are adequately tended to.

Going one step further, when we search to find exactly what this Experiencer is, we find nothing. When we look at the Experience we can not find any object which stands independently of the Experiencer. Therefore, we say that the essence of the Existence is emptiness.

Only reduction of ignorance is required to see that you are the Experiencer.

This is the basic building block of all Experience.

column8: In Emptiness, there is no I to say "I Am Emptiness" therefore you remain in duality if you say "I Am Emptiness". No words can describe your true nature. To reach nonduality, say nothing. There is a limitation of language when it comes to Emptiness and nonduality.

PoK Podcast Link: Karish
What qualifies a student for the path of knowledge? What do to when the required qualifications are absent?

column6: There are no qualifications, all are welcome.
column7: Trust is required for the Path of Knowledge. Complete trust in the Guru
column8: Genuine curiosity and interest in spiritual matters is required to even begin on a spiritual path. Further, intense desire for knowledge and liberation is required. Subgoals of the path can include other important qualities of a seeker which include attention, one's intellect, open minded skepticism, and other critical thinking abilities. Although if the required skills are not present, recommendations may be provided for alternative paths that suit the individual such as the path of devotion for example.

PoK Podcast Link: How to decide what is true and what is false? Justify your response.
Contributor: That which is unchanging is true and that which is changing is false. The essence of who we are is unchanging.
Verifier: That which is unchanging is true and that which is changing is false. This is self evident.
Verified: That which leads to knowledge is true and that which is misleading is false. Knowledge is the only truth in the PoK.
column5: That which is objective is true and that which is subjective is false. Objectivity is the highest criteria for truth.
column6: There is no true and no false.
column7: The Guru will tell us what is true or false based on that particular path.
column8: In the PoK we define truth as unchanging and false as changing. In the PoK we seek the essence of who we are. The essence is the most fundamental, unchanging aspect of something, therefore we say that the essence, which is unchanging is true, and everything else is false.

PoK Podcast Link: What are the symptoms of ignorance?
Contributor: Suffering
Verifier: Bad luck
Verified: Physical affliction
column5: There are no discernable symptoms of ignorance.
column6: Bliss, "ignorance is bliss"
column7: Failure in worldly endevours
column8: Suffering is the key symptom of ignorance. It is the reason that most if not all seekers come to spirituality. In the Path of Knowledge, we see that ignorance is the prime cause for all suffering and we work to remove that ignorance. When there is Self-Realization, we find that our ignorance was the only cause for suffering. There is no "me" who is "suffering", I am the witness of it all, blissful and eternally free from suffering.

PoK Podcast Link: What is the method to arrive at the essence of who you are?
Contributor: Progressive elimination of that which is false.
Verifier: Awareness practice
Verified: Experiencing
column5: No method is required.
column6: Concentration practice
column7: The Guru's grace will lead us to the essence.
column8: Neti Neti, or progressive elimination, will lead one to the essence. If we use the criteria for truth, which is that which is unchanging, it will eventually lead to the essence but we must remove all that is changing. We see that all Experience is changing, therefore the only thing in this Existence which is unchanging is the Experiencer. When we try to find the Experiencer, we find only pure subjectivity, Empty of any substance. Therefore, our essence is Emptiness.

PoK Podcast Link: Why can't the experiencer change just like every other experience?
Contributor: If the Experiencer changes, it will become an Experience.
Verifier: The Experiencer does change because it is the same as the Experience.

column5: There is no Experiencer so it can not change.
column6: Experiences aren't changing, it is only illusion.
column7: The Experiencer can't change because it is limited to this mind and body which is unchanging.
column8: The Experiencer is pure subjectivity. It is the aspect of the Existence which is true, or always present, it is the Existence itself. If we see the Experiencer as changing, then who is seeing the change? The Experiencer is always "behind" the objects it does not have any characteristics.

PoK Podcast Link: What is memory?
Contributor: Memory is a special pattern of vibrations which can take on form of other patterns( vibrations ). It "Stores" the incoming change and can be "Played back" later.
Verifier: Memory is humans ability to recall something
Verified: Memory is storage space in human brain
column5: Experiences are memory
column6: Memory is not a thing, it is the Experiencer appearing as a form so that it can Experience itself in many forms.
column7: Memory is a function of the brain which stores the incoming vibrations as a formatted sensory input
column8: In the realm of Experience, the fundamental building block is vibration, a simple binary state change. There is also a tendency towards survival or reduction of disorder. These vibrations superimpose and self-perpetuate. Eventually, vibrational patterns arise that can take on incoming vibrations and can "replay" the incoming patterns. This is called Memory. Memory can then build more complex structures that filter incoming data for the benefit of the structure, these are called the senses. Remember that this explanation is firmly in the realm of "illusion" or the Experience and can not be said to be True based on our criteria for truth. It is a model to explain the Experience.

PoK Podcast Link: What is a memory bridge? Why do we need it?
Contributor: It is a connection between states and we need it for remembering experience of other states.

column5: A memory bridge allows for remembering past events, we need it for survival.
column6: A memory bridge is a connection between layers of the mind, it allows us to communicate with higher and lower layers.
column7: A memory bridge allows connection to previous spiritual teaching, it allows for contemplation which is required on the Path of Knowledge.
column8: A memory bridge is a connection between states or layers. It allows for remembering other states. For example, when dreaming, if a memory bridge is not present, there is not remembrance of the waking state. And in this case, a memory bridge is required for lucid dreaming. We know that there is a waking state and that states have changed. The same holds true for other states such as the projected state.

PoK Podcast Link: How is a pattern maintained in spite of impermanence?
Contributor: Self organization, defense mechanisms and replication.
Verifier: It is not maintaned, all succumbs to entropy.
Verified: Resonance.
column5: Defense mechanisms which are unknowable.
column6: Memory bridges.
column7: Through repetition which creates more solidified memory.
column8: Patterns organize and replicate to combat impermanence. There are also defence mechanisms in place to repair damage from impermanence. Consider DNA which is simply organization of vibration. It self replicates and is able to repair itself.

PoK Podcast Link: Which method is used to arrive in the nondual state?

column6: By moving out of the experience
column7: By moving to higher layers

Nonduality is not an experience and thus can not be experienced. There are practical tips which can help remove ignorance to see that we are already in the nondual state. Also, there is no "I" or "me" that can arrive in the nondual state.

PoK Podcast Link: Am I with qualities or without?

If we see the Experiencer as having qualities, then who is seeing the qualities? The Experiencer is always "behind" the objects it does not have any characteristics. We can't even say that the Experiencer is "endless" because "endless" implies a beginning. It is eternal.

PoK Podcast Link: Ruchika

PoK Podcast Link: How is the experiencer omnipresent?

Going further, we see that there is only Empty subjectivity without substance, so we say that our nature is Emptiness. Evene further, we see that there is no separation between the Experiencer and Experiencer, thus we are the whole of the Existence which is both empty and full of potential.

PoK Podcast Link: Where are all the past events when they are not being recalled?

PoK Podcast Link: Establish that the waking state is also a dream state.

column6: Dream state is a sub state of waking state

PoK Podcast Link: Why does the memory structure change states?
Contributor: States cannot be static since they are vibration and must go up and down and oscillate this creates the cyclic nature of the memory.
Verifier: Memory structures never change states, they are in an ever present "now" which is ultimately empty and illusory.
Verified: The memory doesn't change states, the attention changes states.

column6: They change based on the desires of the individual
column7: A cause is not applicable in Universal Memory since it is the Existence.
column8: There is a potential for change in the fundamental state which is sleeping. States cannot be static since they are vibration and must go up and down and oscillate. This is the cyclic nature of the memory. Attention shifts from one state to another also for the sake of survival. Remember that causes and processes can be used to explain the illusion only which includes our model of the Universal Memory but does not apply to nonduality or the Existence itself.

PoK Podcast Link: By which process can we merge the experience and the experiencer?

Contributor: Nothing is there to be removed. It is already empty. Statement is false.

PoK Podcast Link: Sweety
What is the most essential knowledge?

Verifier: I Am the Experiencer

This leaves no room for interpretation and the mind stops at this knowledge. The Existence has two apparent sides, an Experiencer which is the whole Existence itself, pure subjectivity, and the Experience which appears as illusory, changing forms. They are not two. There is only this Existence appearing to itself.

PoK Podcast Link: Why is cultivation of qualities a subgoal for a seeker?
Contributor: Without cultivation of qualities progress will be minimal

column6: Qualities are inherent and can not be cultivated
column7: Self Realizaiton requires a sharp intellect and critical thinking therefore these must be cultivated
column8: The qualities of a seeker such as critical thinking, minimalism, discernment, attention, and others are important for eliminating ignorance. The goal of the PoK which is Self Realization can be obtained in just a few minutes but in order to stabilize that realization, hidden ignorance and blind beliefs must be removed. The only way to do this is by cultivating the qualities of a seeker.

PoK Podcast Link: Is there an absolute truth or is it always relative?
Contributor: True and false do not apply in nonduality
Verifier: Both are always relative
Verified: Absolute truth is that I Am the Experiencer, all else is relative
column5: Truth is that which does not change, all that changes can be considered relative truth
column6: All is false, there is no truth
column7: The absolute truth can only be known when in the state of Experiencing
column8: The terms Absolute and Existence refer to Emptiness and nonduality. We can not use dual terms to describe anything in nonduality. True and false are terms that are used in duality and can not apply to the Absolute.

PoK Podcast Link: Define and establish Existence.
Contributor: It is all that is, the Experiencer and Experience are one and there that is the Existence
Verifier: The Existence can not be defined or established it is nondual
Verified: It is Experiencing

column6: It is Emptiness
column7: It is all that is known, the unknown can not be included
column8: The Existence is all that is, known and unknown, manifested, and unmanifested. We see two sides to the Existence which is a division of the mind, the Experiencer and the Experience. In the end, we see that these are not separate and that there is one reality appearing to itself as illusory forms.

PoK Podcast Link: Elimination method reduces me to nothing. True or false?
Contributor: False, elimination method reduces all that is changing including the illusory "me"
Verifier: True, I am reduced to my nature which is the Experiencer and that is nothing
Verified: There is no answer to this question
column5: True, the goal of elimination method is an experience of nothing
column6: False, I am reduced to the Existence which is everything, not nothing.

column8: The elimination method or "neti neti" brings us to the essence. This question solidifies the individual "me" and says that the "me" becomes nothing. The "me" such as the mind and body is seen in progressive elimination as illusory Experiences. What is left is the Essence. What is left is Emptiness which is the whole. It is impersonal and not related to "me".

PoK Podcast Link: What are the consequences of ignorace of our true nature?
Contributor: Suffering
Verifier: Bad luck
Verified: Physical affliction
column5: There are no discernable symptoms of ignorance.
column6: Bliss, "ignorance is bliss"
column7: Failure in worldly endevours

PoK Podcast Link: What are the consequences of self realisation?
Contributor: Silence
Verifier: Happiness and ecstacy
Verified: Compassion for all beings
column5: Love
column6: Boost in intellect
column7: Siddhis
column8: With Self Realization we come to know that we are the Experiencer and thus the whole of the Existence. We know that all that is appearing is illusory, including the mind and body. This ends the struggle of the individual. The mind becomes content as no further knowledge can be acquired. Silence is the result.

PoK Podcast Link: If everything is one, how did duality arise in it?

Verifier: Activity of the mind

column6: Survival

It never actually arose within the Existence. The duality is appearing within the nonduality. Although we have models for the duality that can explain some of the characteristics that we see, these are only models and are all appearing within the one. There is no process that the one becomes two.

PoK Podcast Link: Is memory real?
Contributor: Memory is changing and thus unreal

column8: Memory is a hypothesis to explain the illusion. The model includes the basic assumption of vibration and organization of vibration. From this perspective it is unreal. From another perspective if we assume the hypothesis, we can directly see that all that is Experienced is memory. Is Experience changing? Yes, thus it is false or unreal. Real in this question is equivalent to true and unreal is equivalent to false, therefore we can apply our criteria for truth

PoK Podcast Link: What is the reason for taking a human birth? Who takes it?
Contributor: Desire, no one takes birth
Verifier: Desire, the soul takes birth
Verified: There is no reason for taking a human birth and no individual
column5: The Existence wants to Experience itself in illusory forms, so it takes birth
column6: Vibration organizes and results in the illusion of human birth
column7: The memory of the individual takes birth, they do this to complete prior work and attain liberation
column8: When we look at our direct experience we see a constant flow of desires which drives action. These are present in all states, including waking, dreaming, projected, and sleep. We can assume they are present in the death state as well even with this apparent local memory and body is dissolved. If this is the case, desire will drive human birth so that the desires can be fulfilled. We call this "storehouse" of desire the causal body, although this is not an individual or a person or a soul.
